verses.kjv: The burden of the word of the LORD in the land of Hadrach, and Damascus shall be the rest thereof: when the eyes of man, as of all the tribes of Israel, shall be toward the LORD.
verses.ct: A message from the LORD concerning the land of Hadrach, with Damascus as its resting place — for the eyes of all people, along with all the tribes of Israel, are directed toward the LORD.

verses.kjv: And Hamath also shall border thereby; Tyrus, and Zidon, though it be very wise.
verses.ct: Hamath, which borders it, will also be included, as well as Tyre and Sidon, despite all their cleverness.

verses.kjv: And Tyrus did build herself a strong hold, and heaped up silver as the dust, and fine gold as the mire of the streets.
verses.ct: Tyre built herself a fortress and piled up silver like dust and fine gold like mud in the streets.

verses.kjv: Behold, the LORD will cast her out, and he will smite her power in the sea; and she shall be devoured with fire.
verses.ct: But look — the Lord will strip her of her possessions and strike down her power at sea, and she will be consumed by fire.

verses.kjv: Ashkelon shall see it, and fear; Gaza also shall see it, and be very sorrowful, and Ekron; for her expectation shall be ashamed; and the king shall perish from Gaza, and Ashkelon shall not be inhabited.
verses.ct: Ashkelon will witness this and be terrified. Gaza will see it too and writhe in agony, along with Ekron, because what they hoped for will come to nothing. Gaza's king will be destroyed, and Ashkelon will be left empty.

verses.kjv: And a bastard shall dwell in Ashdod, and I will cut off the pride of the Philistines.
verses.ct: A foreign people will occupy Ashdod, and I will put an end to the arrogance of the Philistines.

verses.kjv: And I will take away his blood out of his mouth, and his abominations from between his teeth: but he that remaineth, even he, shall be for our God, and he shall be as a governor in Judah, and Ekron as a Jebusite.
verses.ct: I will remove the blood from their mouths and the disgusting food from between their teeth. But those who survive will belong to our God — they will become like a clan in Judah, and Ekron will be absorbed like the Jebusites were.

verses.kjv: And I will encamp about mine house because of the army, because of him that passeth by, and because of him that returneth: and no oppressor shall pass through them any more: for now have I seen with mine eyes.
verses.ct: I will stand guard around my house against any army, against anyone who comes or goes. No oppressor will overrun them again, because now I am watching with my own eyes.

verses.kjv: Rejoice greatly, O daughter of Zion; shout, O daughter of Jerusalem: behold, thy King cometh unto thee: he is just, and having salvation; lowly, and riding upon an ass, and upon a colt the foal of an ass.
verses.ct: Celebrate with great joy, people of Zion! Shout out loud, people of Jerusalem! Look — your King is coming to you! He is righteous and brings salvation, humble and riding on a donkey — on a young colt, the offspring of a donkey.

verses.kjv: And I will cut off the chariot from Ephraim, and the horse from Jerusalem, and the battle bow shall be cut off: and he shall speak peace unto the heathen: and his dominion shall be from sea even to sea, and from the river even to the ends of the earth.
verses.ct: I will remove the war chariots from Ephraim and the warhorses from Jerusalem. The battle bow will be destroyed. He will announce peace to the nations, and his rule will stretch from sea to sea, from the Euphrates River to the ends of the earth.

verses.kjv: As for thee also, by the blood of thy covenant I have sent forth thy prisoners out of the pit wherein is no water.
verses.ct: As for you, because of the blood of my covenant with you, I have freed your prisoners from the waterless pit.

verses.kjv: Turn you to the strong hold, ye prisoners of hope: even to day do I declare that I will render double unto thee;
verses.ct: Return to your place of safety, you prisoners who still have hope! Even today I announce that I will repay you double.

verses.kjv: When I have bent Judah for me, filled the bow with Ephraim, and raised up thy sons, O Zion, against thy sons, O Greece, and made thee as the sword of a mighty man.
verses.ct: I will bend Judah as my bow and load Ephraim as my arrow. I will stir up your sons, Zion, against your sons, Greece, and wield you like a warrior's sword.

verses.kjv: And the LORD shall be seen over them, and his arrow shall go forth as the lightning: and the LORD God shall blow the trumpet, and shall go with whirlwinds of the south.
verses.ct: Then the LORD will appear above them, and his arrow will flash out like lightning. The Lord GOD will sound the trumpet and advance with the storms of the south.

verses.kjv: The LORD of hosts shall defend them; and they shall devour, and subdue with sling stones; and they shall drink, and make a noise as through wine; and they shall be filled like bowls, and as the corners of the altar.
verses.ct: The LORD of hosts will shield them. They will destroy their enemies and trample them with sling stones. They will celebrate and roar as if filled with wine; they will overflow like sacrificial bowls, drenched like the corners of the altar.

verses.kjv: And the LORD their God shall save them in that day as the flock of his people: for they shall be as the stones of a crown, lifted up as an ensign upon his land.
verses.ct: The LORD their God will rescue them on that day as the flock of his people. They will sparkle like jewels in a crown, raised high over his land.

verses.kjv: For how great is his goodness, and how great is his beauty! corn shall make the young men cheerful, and new wine the maids.
verses.ct: How wonderful is his goodness, and how stunning is his beauty! Grain will make the young men thrive, and new wine will strengthen the young women.
